paragraphs: Ketma Welfare Foundation (formerly Ketma Paryavaran Sanrakshan Samiti) was established in 2012 in Ambikapur, Surguja district, Chhattisgarh ‚Äî one of India's most ecologically sensitive and tribally significant regions. After a decade of foundational environmental work, the organization was formally revived, restructured, and re-registered in 2025 under the visionary leadership of President Mr. Ankit Soni, a Mining Engineer with deep expertise in remote sensing, geospatial analysis, and environmental science.

What makes Ketma different is not just its mission ‚Äî it's the investment behind it. Before ever seeking a single rupee of external funding, the founding team invested over ‚Çπ70 Lakhs of personal capital into land restoration, lemongrass cultivation, distillation infrastructure, and community training. This is not a proposal-driven NGO ‚Äî this is a results-first institution that has already built the proof of concept with its own hands and resources.

Today, Ketma operates across 10 formally registered domains ‚Äî from environmental conservation and organic agriculture to women's empowerment, tribal welfare, public health, education, disaster management, and CSR facilitation. Its integrated model treats ecology, livelihood, and community dignity as inseparable ‚Äî because they are.

introParagraphs: The story of Ketma is not one of overnight transformation ‚Äî it is a story of patient, persistent, science-driven commitment to a land and its people.

It began in 2012, when a group of environmentally conscious individuals in Ambikapur recognized that Surguja's vast tracts of barren, eroded land were not hopeless ‚Äî they were untapped potential. What they needed was not charity, but science, systems, and someone willing to invest before asking others to believe.

timeline.title: Foundation Established
timeline.description: Ketma Paryavaran Sanrakshan Samiti registered in Ambikapur, Surguja, Chhattisgarh ‚Äî focused on environmental conservation and community development in one of India's most ecologically fragile tribal regions.

timeline.title: A Decade of Groundwork
timeline.description: Over ten years of foundational environmental work ‚Äî land surveys, community relationship building, understanding soil degradation patterns, and developing the scientific framework for large-scale restoration.

timeline.title: The Bold Investment
timeline.description: Founding team invests ‚Çπ70 Lakhs+ of personal capital into land restoration, lemongrass cultivation across 110 acres, establishment of Surguja's first organic essential oil distillation unit, and comprehensive community training programs.

timeline.title: Formal Revival & Amendment
timeline.description: Organization formally restructured and renamed as Ketma Welfare Foundation. Registrar Amendment Order issued 31 July 2025, expanding scope to 10 registered domains under the visionary leadership of President Mr. Ankit Soni.

timeline.title: Darpan Registration & National Recognition
timeline.description: NGO Darpan registration secured ‚Äî ID: CG/2025/0801889 ‚Äî marking Ketma's formal entry into the national ecosystem of recognized development organizations. 80G application initiated.

timeline.title: Scaling Impact
timeline.description: Launching herbal product lines, expanding CSR partnerships, government engagement, and preparing to scale the proven model across Chhattisgarh and beyond.

mission.intro: Our mission is anchored in seven interconnected pillars ‚Äî because lasting change requires nothing less than a complete ecosystem of action.

pillars.title: Ecological Restoration
pillars.text: Rehabilitate degraded land through scientific methods, afforestation, and sustainable agriculture ‚Äî restoring both soil and hope.

pillars.title: Community Empowerment
pillars.text: Build the capacity of tribal and rural communities ‚Äî especially women ‚Äî to lead their own transformation through skills, enterprise, and self-governance.

pillars.title: Scientific Rigor
pillars.text: Apply research-grade methodologies (RUSLE modeling, geospatial analysis, soil science) to every intervention ‚Äî because impact without measurement is just activity.

pillars.title: Enterprise Development
pillars.text: Create farm-to-market value chains, organic product lines, and sustainable businesses that generate lasting livelihoods ‚Äî not temporary jobs.

pillars.title: Health & Education
pillars.text: Advance public health awareness, herbal medicine access, educational opportunity, and digital literacy in underserved communities.

pillars.title: Institutional Partnerships
pillars.text: Bridge communities with government programs, CSR partners, research institutions, and markets ‚Äî creating an ecosystem of support.

pillars.title: Accountability & Transparency
pillars.text: Maintain rigorous documentation, impact measurement, and financial transparency ‚Äî because trust is earned with evidence, not promises.

paragraphs: Ketma Welfare Foundation is actively positioning itself as a credible, science-driven implementation partner for government programs in Chhattisgarh. With formal registration, NGO Darpan credentials, and a proven model of land restoration and community development, the Foundation seeks to collaborate with district and state administration on flagship programs.

Our expertise in environmental science, geospatial analysis, organic agriculture, and tribal community engagement makes us uniquely qualified to implement schemes under MGNREGA convergence, National Afforestation Programme, PM-KUSUM, Tribal Sub-Plan, and various state-level livelihood missions.

We believe the most effective government programs are those implemented by organizations that already have community trust, local infrastructure, and scientific methodology ‚Äî and Ketma offers all three.

pressRelease.headline: Ketma Welfare Foundation Emerges as Surguja's Most Ambitious Grassroots Restoration Initiative ‚Äî 110 Acres Restored, 24.2 Lakh Lemongrass Slips Planted, ‚Çπ70 Lakhs Self-Invested
body: Ketma Welfare Foundation, a restructured and revitalized non-profit organization based in Ambikapur, Surguja district, Chhattisgarh, today announced its formal re-emergence as one of the region's most comprehensive grassroots institutions for environmental restoration, tribal empowerment, and sustainable development.

Originally established in 2012 as Ketma Paryavaran Sanrakshan Samiti, the organization has undergone a complete structural transformation in 2025 under the leadership of President Mr. Ankit Soni ‚Äî a Mining Engineer with expertise in remote sensing, geospatial analysis, and environmental science. The organization's scope has been expanded to cover 10 formally registered domains, and its Darpan registration (ID: CG/2025/0801889) marks its entry into the national ecosystem of recognized development organizations.

The Foundation's flagship initiative ‚Äî 'Green Land, Green Futures' ‚Äî has already achieved remarkable milestones: 110 acres of barren, eroded land transformed through scientific soil analysis (RUSLE model) and lemongrass cultivation, with 24.2 lakh slips planted. The team has established Surguja district's first organic essential oil distillation unit, created a complete farm-to-bottle production chain, and developed a diversified product line including essential oils, room fresheners, incense sticks, organic soaps, and herbal teas.

What distinguishes Ketma from conventional NGOs is its investment model ‚Äî the founding team has invested over ‚Çπ70 Lakhs of personal capital into infrastructure, cultivation, and community training before seeking any external funding. This results-first approach has built genuine community trust and created a replicable model for other regions.
The Foundation now seeks strategic CSR partnerships, government collaboration, and community support to scale its proven model across Chhattisgarh and beyond.
